intro: Coffea kianjavatensis, commonly known as the Kianjavatensis coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Madagascar, specifically the eastern rainforests. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It is known for its unique flavor profile, which includes notes of citrus and berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
